numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a pattern.
2. Many countries have people who think that the world is becoming a better place with each coming generation.
3. These countries tend to be less wealthy than some other countries.
4. Spain is a country.
5. France is a country.
6. The United Kingdom is a country.
7. In Spain, in France, and in the United Kingdom, many people think that the world is becoming a worse place with each coming generation.
8. I noticed that Indonesia is an outlier.
9. Indonesia stands out from the other countries by a decent amount.
10. I wonder about a reason.
11. Many wealthier countries have an older generation.
12. In many wealthier countries, the older generation does not think that the world is becoming better with every generation.
13. I wonder whether this is because of the wealth of the country.
14. I also wonder whether this is due to how the older generation was raised.
15. Some older people may fear change.
16. Some older people may think that change is a negative thing.
17. I live in a community.
18. In my community, most teens think that the world is becoming a better place with every generation.
19. I am a teen.
20. I think that the world is becoming a better place with every generation.
21. I cannot speak for the older generation in my community.
